org.forgerock.openam.radius.server.config

Class RadiusServerConstants

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.radius.server.config.RadiusServerConstants

  • public final class RadiusServerConstants
extends Object
    Constants used by the RADIUS server implementation. Created by markboyd on 11/12/14.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CLIENT_ATT_CLASSNAME
      In a configured radius client this is the fully qualified name of a class that implements the AccessRequestHandler interface and will handle requests from that client.
      static String CLIENT_ATT_IP_ADDR
      In a configured radius client this is the name of the attribute whose value indicates IP source address from which a UDP packet must be received to be accepted and processed by the server.
      static String CLIENT_ATT_LOG_PACKETS
      In a configured radius client this is the name of the attribute whose value indicates if request and response packets for the client should be dumped to log with all content visible save for the USER_PASSWORD field which is obfiscated with asterisks in place of characters.
      static String CLIENT_ATT_PROPERTIES
      In a configured radius client this is the name of a list of configuration properties specific to the handler class.
      static String CLIENT_ATT_SECRET
      In a configured radius client this is the name of the attribute whose value holds the secret shared between server and client and used to encrypt and decrypt the packet authenticators providing signer authenticity and message integrity.
      static String COORDINATION_THREAD_NAME
      The name of the thread that is responsible for starting up the RADIUS service as openAM startup and making adjustments when RADIUS configuration changes occur in the openAM admin console.
      static String[] EMPTY_STRING_ARY
      Empty String array pattern for use in toArray().
      static String GBL_ATT_LISTENER_ENABLED
      Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates if RADIUS server features should be turned on allowing RADIUS clients to use openAM as a RADIUS server for authentication.
      static String GBL_ATT_LISTENER_PORT
      Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the port on which to listen for RADIUS access-request requests.
      static String GBL_ATT_QUEUE_SIZE
      Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the number of items that can be queued up for the thread pool before additional items will be dropped and not processed.
      static String GBL_ATT_THREADS_CORE_SIZE
      Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the core pool size for the executor thread pool that processes incoming RADIUS requests.
      static String GBL_ATT_THREADS_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS
      Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the number of seconds idle threads should be kept in the pool when the number of threads are greater than the core pool size.
      static String GBL_ATT_THREADS_MAX_SIZE
      Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the max pool size for the executor thread pool that processes incoming RADIUS requests.
      static String LISTENER_THREAD_NAME
      The name of the thread that binds to the port, listens for requests, and launches request handlers.
      static int MAX_PACKET_SIZE
      The maximum radius packet size as per section 3 of rfc 2865.
      static int RADIUS_AUTHN_PORT
      The default port for RADIUS authentication as specified in rfc 2865.
      static String RADIUS_SERVER_LOGGER
      The name of the logger used by the radius server classes.
      static String RADIUS_SERVICE_CFG_FILE
      The classpath based path to the file that defines the configuration pieces in openAM's admin console for the RADIUS server functionality.
      static String RADIUS_SERVICE_NAME
      The unique name of the RADIUS service registered in the admin console with our amRadiusServer.xml file exposing configuration pieces in openAM's admin console.
      static String REQUEST_HANDLER_THREAD_NAME
      The name of the thread that handles requests.
      static long THREAD_POOL_SHUTDOWN_WAIT_SECONDS
      The time period in seconds allowed for the RADIUS request handling pool to finish process current requests before another warning message will be issued to log indicating that the pool is taking longer than allowed.

    • Method Summary

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • GBL_ATT_LISTENER_ENABLED

        public static final String GBL_ATT_LISTENER_ENABLED
        Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates if RADIUS server features should be turned on allowing RADIUS clients to use openAM as a RADIUS server for authentication. See the service descriptor amRadiusServer.xml file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GBL_ATT_LISTENER_PORT

        public static final String GBL_ATT_LISTENER_PORT
        Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the port on which to listen for RADIUS access-request requests. See the service descriptor amRadiusServer.xml file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GBL_ATT_THREADS_CORE_SIZE

        public static final String GBL_ATT_THREADS_CORE_SIZE
        Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the core pool size for the executor thread pool that processes incoming RADIUS requests. See the service descriptor amRadiusServer.xml file and ThreadPoolExecutor for details.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GBL_ATT_THREADS_MAX_SIZE

        public static final String GBL_ATT_THREADS_MAX_SIZE
        Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the max pool size for the executor thread pool that processes incoming RADIUS requests. See the service descriptor amRadiusServer.xml file and ThreadPoolExecutor for details.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GBL_ATT_THREADS_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS

        public static final String GBL_ATT_THREADS_KEEPALIVE_SECONDS
        Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the number of seconds idle threads should be kept in the pool when the number of threads are greater than the core pool size. See the service descriptor amRadiusServer.xml file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GBL_ATT_QUEUE_SIZE

        public static final String GBL_ATT_QUEUE_SIZE
        Name of the global radius service attribute whose value indicates the number of items that can be queued up for the thread pool before additional items will be dropped and not processed. See the service descriptor amRadiusServer.xml file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_ATT_IP_ADDR

        public static final String CLIENT_ATT_IP_ADDR
        In a configured radius client this is the name of the attribute whose value indicates IP source address from which a UDP packet must be received to be accepted and processed by the server. If an incoming packet has a source IP address that does not match any client then the packet is dropped silently according to spec. This value matches the corresponding field name declared in the amRadiusServer.xml file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_ATT_SECRET

        public static final String CLIENT_ATT_SECRET
        In a configured radius client this is the name of the attribute whose value holds the secret shared between server and client and used to encrypt and decrypt the packet authenticators providing signer authenticity and message integrity. This value matches the corresponding field name declared in the amRadiusServer.xml file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_ATT_LOG_PACKETS

        public static final String CLIENT_ATT_LOG_PACKETS
        In a configured radius client this is the name of the attribute whose value indicates if request and response packets for the client should be dumped to log with all content visible save for the USER_PASSWORD field which is obfiscated with asterisks in place of characters.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_ATT_CLASSNAME

        public static final String CLIENT_ATT_CLASSNAME
        In a configured radius client this is the fully qualified name of a class that implements the AccessRequestHandler interface and will handle requests from that client.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_ATT_PROPERTIES

        public static final String CLIENT_ATT_PROPERTIES
        In a configured radius client this is the name of a list of configuration properties specific to the handler class.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EMPTY_STRING_ARY

        public static final String[] EMPTY_STRING_ARY
        Empty String array pattern for use in toArray().

      • COORDINATION_THREAD_NAME

        public static final String COORDINATION_THREAD_NAME
        The name of the thread that is responsible for starting up the RADIUS service as openAM startup and making adjustments when RADIUS configuration changes occur in the openAM admin console.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LISTENER_THREAD_NAME

        public static final String LISTENER_THREAD_NAME
        The name of the thread that binds to the port, listens for requests, and launches request handlers. The port on which we listen is included in the name when starting the listener.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REQUEST_HANDLER_THREAD_NAME

        public static final String REQUEST_HANDLER_THREAD_NAME
        The name of the thread that handles requests.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_PACKET_SIZE

        public static final int MAX_PACKET_SIZE
        The maximum radius packet size as per section 3 of rfc 2865.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • THREAD_POOL_SHUTDOWN_WAIT_SECONDS

        public static final long THREAD_POOL_SHUTDOWN_WAIT_SECONDS
        The time period in seconds allowed for the RADIUS request handling pool to finish process current requests before another warning message will be issued to log indicating that the pool is taking longer than allowed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
